html:
6.8.17  9:54 am   hi bill, do you have any tips on how to keep yourself motivated throughout an entire project? how do you keep yourself from getting tired and quitting on something that takes as long as the hotewig


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/advice-for-long-projects.html


6.8.17  9:54 am   hi bill, do you have any tips on how to keep yourself motivated throughout an entire project? how do you keep yourself from getting tired and quitting on something that takes as long as the hotewig

     

5.27.17  11:54 am   bill im so envious of your creativity and ingenuity. i have an urge to create stuff but apparently it's not strong enough because i always stop doing it for various reasons. i'm a good drawer, a decent editor and a decent music man but i always give up on my ideas and on my stuff. i feel like that proves that i'm not meant to be any of those things but maybe im wrong. whats your take on it?

     

5.22.17  5:37 am   how do you force yourself to commit to a project when you lack confidence in your abilities and worry about all the things you could be doing instead? there's so many things i want to do & make but every choice feels like the wrong one. this results in me choosing nothing, which is the only wrong choice. regardless, i'm frozen in indecision.

     

4.24.17  11:11 pm   I've been trying to do an art project important to me for a while now but I can't get into it. I really do *want* to though. What is your advice as someone who has actually done a bunch of things to those of us who can't get up those first few steps towards doing things of their own?

     

4.11.17  1:12 am   so I've noticed a consistent problem when I try to record is I try really hard to make everything absolutely perfect, so I never really get anything finished and/or posted. do you have any suggestions on overcoming shit like that so I can get some content out there? thank you for what you do man it's so fun

     

4.4.17  10:39 am   how do i inspire myself to do creative art-type things when i always give up like 5 minutes in when i see what is shaping up to be Overall Poor In Quality and end up with severe anxiety and self-loathing and need to stop immediately

     

4.1.17  4:45 am   How to find a way to form habits and disciple myself to work on larger projects for extended periods of time? For example, how did you sustain yourself to keep on working with the same intensity on HOTEWIG for over nine months?

     

3.26.17  9:34 pm   Do you have any advice on staying on track when working on a project? Whenever i am making a song or something, i end up wandering off topic and doing something completely different than i originally wanted, and it creates big drawbacks, with me usually just giving up by the end. Do you have any idea as to how i might go about fixing this issue?

     

3.25.17  7:28 pm   Whenever I try to create something artistic and start but get stuck in the middle my mind tends to wander. At first I will be trying to find ideas to advance the project but I then begin to think of other art-ish things that have little or no relation to the project I am currently working on (like going from writing a poem to thinking of musical riffs). I understand this isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it becomes a problem when I need to get a project done (I am a student). Any advice you can give about this?

     

7.13.16  11:16 pm   Whenever I'm working on art projects and stuff, I always push myself too hard and give up whenever my technical/physical skills aren't good enough to reproduce the ideas I have in my mind. As a result, I never seem to finish most of the projects I start. Any advice?

     

     try much shorter projects first, they are much easier to finish, and you will get some practice and hone in on your process. then when you are ready you can move to longer projects, and you will complete them handily because you will know what you're doing by that time
